title._content: Paris -- German Shop smashed by mob  (LOC)

description._content: Bain News Service,, publisher. Paris -- German Shop smashed by mob [1914] 1 negative : glass ; 5 x 7 in. or smaller. Notes: Title from data provided by the Bain News Service on the negative. Similar image from Bridgeman art, culture & history images website is dated August, 1914. Photograph shows Appenrodt's restaurant, which was owned by H. Apptenrodt on the Boulevard des Italiens in Paris, France. The restaurant was attacked by a French mob who thought the owner was a German national, during the early days of World War I. (Source: Flickr Commons project, 2011 and New York Times, Nov. 19, 1914) Forms part of: George Grantham Bain Collection (Library of Congress). Subjects: World War, 1914-1918. Paris Format: Glass negatives. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print General information about the Bain Collection is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.ggbain Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ggbain.16964 Call Number: LC-B2- 3201-6
